metadata.Title: CVE-2013-1854 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The Active Record component in Ruby on Rails 2.3.x before 2.3.18, 3.1.x before 3.1.12, and 3.2.x before 3.2.13 processes certain queries by converting hash keys to symbols, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service via crafted input to a where method.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-1854` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ruby-activerecord-3.2 - 3.2.6-5
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> in Oneiric+, rails package is just for transition

criterions.comment: ruby-activerecord-3.2 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.2.6-5').
